ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: The fit.models function and its associated methods (coefficients, print, summary, plot, etc.) were originally provided in the robust package to compare robustly and classically fitted model objects. The aim of the fit.models package is to separate this fitted model object comparison functionality from the robust package and to extend it to support fitting methods (e.g., classical, robust, Bayesian, regularized, etc.) more generally.

The fit.models function and its associated methods (coefficients, print, summary, plot, etc.) were originally provided in the robust package to compare robustly and classically fitted model objects. The aim of the fit.models package is to separate this fitted model object comparison functionality from the robust package and to extend it to support fitting methods (e.g., classical, robust, Bayesian, regularized, etc.) more generally.

name: r-fit.models
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.64" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-fit.models
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: fit.models_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/fit.models_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/fit.models/fit.models_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f70806bfa85a05337fa5a665264d640e307584714a07a329fbe96c86b0e864da

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 4
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-lattice
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-lattice

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('fit.models')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('fit.models')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=fit.models
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: The fit.models function and its associated methods (coefficients, print, summary, plot, etc.) were originally provided in the robust package to compare robustly and classically fitted model objects. The aim of the fit.models package is to separate this fitted model object comparison functionality from the robust
    package and to extend it to support fitting methods (e.g., classical, robust, Bayesian, regularized, etc.) more generally.
  license_family: GPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - rvalieris
